comment: The data were generated at DLR as part of the ECMWF C3S2_312a_Lot2 project for the Copernicus Climate Change Service (C3S), and were produced using algorithms developed in the framework of the European Space Agency's Climate Change Initiative (ESA CCI).   They were reformatted into Obs4MIPs format by the CCI CMUG project.
grid: data gridded to 1x1 degree lat x lon
license: Data in this file produced by DLR is licensed under a DLR CC BY-NC-ND 3.0 licence (https://www.dlr.de/en/service/imprint).  Use of the data must be acknowledged. Further information about this data, including some limitations, can be found via https://atmos.eoc.dlr.de/app/products/gto-ecv.
references: GTO-ECV reference: Coldewey-Egbers et al., The GOME-type Total Ozone Essential Climate Variable (GTO-ECV) data record from the ESA Climate Change Initiative, Atmos. Meas.Tech., 8, 3923-3940, 2015. https://amt.copernicus.org/articles/8/3923/2015/amt-8-3923-2015.pdf
title: L3 total ozone satellite observations v9.0
#comment: The following are CMOR internal settings and should not be edited by the user
_history_template: %s; CMOR rewrote data to be consistent with <activity_id>, and <Conventions> standards
